title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 January 2015 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <vmassol> (I've restarted it)  
09:27 <vmassol> XWIKI-11651  
09:28 <vmassol> strange  
09:28 <woshilapin> has quit  
09:29 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning  
09:30 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <vmassol> I was asking about status for 6.4 final this morning  
09:30 <vmassol> "I need marius status on the new trees integration, a lot of issues are still open"  
09:30 <vmassol> "(only 1 is closed actually out of 9 listed)"  
09:30 <vmassol> I'm referring to the issues listed on the roadmap page: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/  
09:30 <vmassol> what's the status and what's the plan?  
09:37 <mflorea> good morning vmassol  
09:38 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <mflorea> the status is as shown on the roadmap page. Only one issue closed. I'm currently working on integrating the tree in the wysiwyg editor  
09:39 <mflorea> XWIKI-5484 and XWIKI-3796 in the roadmap list  
09:39 <mflorea> then the plan is to use the new tree for the DBTreeList properties, but for 6.4.1 most probably  
09:40 <mflorea> that is XWIKI-8760, XWIKI-11398 and XWIKI-5852  
09:41 <mflorea> integrating the tree in the DW (report step can be done as part of the DW work planned for 7.0)  
09:42 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <mflorea> that is XWIKI-10204  
09:44 <mflorea> the remaining 2, XWIKI-11046 and XWIKI-11550, are for 6.4.1  
09:49 <vmassol> mflorea: 6.4 final is Monday  
09:50 <mflorea> I know  
09:50 <vmassol> what do you want to do for 6.4 final?  
09:50 <vmassol> maybe all should go in 6.4.1?  
09:50 <vmassol> I'm also worried about that delay this will globally generate for your work on the 7.0 roadmap  
09:51 <vmassol> do we need to delay 6.4 final and introduce a 6.4RC2?  
09:51 <mflorea> as I said, I'm currently work on integrating the tree in the wysiwyg editor, this can get into 6.4 final. the rest in 6.4.1  
09:52 <mflorea> no, I think we should stick with 6.4 final and then 6.4.1  
09:52 <vmassol> but 6.4 should not have any changes normally since RC1 is already released...  
09:52 <vmassol> will you be ready for Monday?  
09:52 <mflorea> I know the rule, but when did we ever do this?...  
09:52 <vmassol> yes we did a lot in the past  
09:53 <vmassol> we very rarely committed stuff after RC in the past  
09:53 <vmassol> and then at some point we started accepting it a bit more  
09:53 <mflorea> that's not what I recall  
09:53 <vmassol> in any case it's not something to do at all  
09:53 <Bugendolf> has quit  
09:54 <vmassol> and introducing a new RC is usually preferable unless the stuff committed is really limited and safe  
09:54 <vmassol> the real question is whether you'll be ready for Monday  
09:54 <vmassol> (since we can have a 6.4.1 realtively quickly after we could accept the risk)  
09:55 <mflorea> I might be ready with the wysiwyg integration, but the rest will be left for 6.4.1  
10:00 <Bugendolf> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <vmassol> just checked, we've never had any final release without any issue, we've had 2 final with only 1 issue though… but indeed majority varies between 10-40  
10:07 <vmassol> a lot for 6.x, less for 5.x, 4.x, 3.x, quite a lot for 2.x
